comment_text.dn7:1.2: This sutta depicts the events that were subsequently related by the Buddha in the previous sutta, DN 6.

root_text.dn7:1.2: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kosambiyaṁ viharati ghositārāme.
root_text.dn7:1.3: Tena kho pana samayena dve pabbajitā—
root_text.dn7:1.4: muṇḍiyo ca paribbājako jāliyo ca dārupattikantevāsī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodiṁsu.
root_text.dn7:1.5: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho te dve pabbajitā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
root_text.dn7:1.6: “kiṁ nu kho, āvuso gotama, taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīraṁ, udāhu aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran”ti?
root_text.dn7:1.7: “Tena hāvuso, suṇātha sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
root_text.dn7:1.8: “Evamāvuso”ti kho te dve pabbajitā bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
root_text.dn7:2.2: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu sīlasampanno hoti.
root_text.dn7:2.5: Yo kho, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṁ jānāti evaṁ passati, kallaṁ nu kho tassetaṁ vacanāya:
root_text.dn7:2.6: ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti vāti.
root_text.dn7:2.7: Yo so, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṁ jānāti evaṁ passati, kallaṁ tassetaṁ vacanāya:
root_text.dn7:2.8: ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti vāti.
root_text.dn7:2.9: Ahaṁ kho panetaṁ, āvuso, evaṁ jānāmi evaṁ passāmi.
root_text.dn7:2.11: ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti vā …pe…
root_text.dn7:3.4: Yo kho, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṁ jānāti evaṁ passati, kallaṁ nu kho tassetaṁ vacanāya:
root_text.dn7:3.5: ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti vāti?
root_text.dn7:3.6: Yo so, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṁ jānāti evaṁ passati kallaṁ, tassetaṁ vacanāya:
root_text.dn7:3.7: ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti vāti.
root_text.dn7:3.8: Ahaṁ kho panetaṁ, āvuso, evaṁ jānāmi evaṁ passāmi.
root_text.dn7:3.10: ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti vā …pe…
root_text.dn7:4.2: yo kho, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṁ jānāti evaṁ passati, kallaṁ nu kho tassetaṁ vacanāya:
root_text.dn7:4.3: ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti vāti.
root_text.dn7:4.4: Yo so, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṁ jānāti evaṁ passati kallaṁ tassetaṁ vacanāya:
root_text.dn7:4.5: ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti vāti.
root_text.dn7:4.6: Ahaṁ kho panetaṁ, āvuso, evaṁ jānāmi evaṁ passāmi.
root_text.dn7:4.8: ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti vā …pe….
root_text.dn7:5.2: Yo kho, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṁ jānāti evaṁ passati, kallaṁ nu kho tassetaṁ vacanāya:
root_text.dn7:5.3: ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti vāti?
root_text.dn7:5.4: Yo so, āvuso, bhikkhu evaṁ jānāti evaṁ passati, na kallaṁ tassetaṁ vacanāya:
root_text.dn7:5.5: ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti vāti.
root_text.dn7:5.6: Ahaṁ kho panetaṁ, āvuso, evaṁ jānāmi evaṁ passāmi.
root_text.dn7:5.8: ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti vā ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti vā”ti.
root_text.dn7:5.10: Attamanā te dve pabbajitā bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.

translation_text.dn7:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambī, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
translation_text.dn7:1.3: Now at that time two renunciates—
translation_text.dn7:1.4: the wanderer Muṇḍiya and Jāliya, the pupil of the wood-bowl ascetic—came to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.
translation_text.dn7:1.5: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they stood to one side and said to the Buddha,
translation_text.dn7:1.6: “Reverend Gotama, are the soul and the body one and the same, or is the soul one thing, the body another?”
translation_text.dn7:1.7: “Well then, reverends, listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”
translation_text.dn7:2.1: “Take the case when a Realized One arises in the world, perfected, a fully awakened Buddha …
translation_text.dn7:2.2: That’s how a mendicant is accomplished in ethics. …
translation_text.dn7:2.4: They enter and remain in the first absorption …
translation_text.dn7:2.5: When a mendicant knows and sees like this, would it be appropriate to say of them:
translation_text.dn7:2.6: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’?”
translation_text.dn7:2.9: “But reverends, I know and see like this.
translation_text.dn7:2.11: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’. …
translation_text.dn7:3.1: They enter and remain in the second absorption …
translation_text.dn7:3.4: When a mendicant knows and sees like this, would it be appropriate to say of them:
translation_text.dn7:3.5: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’?”
translation_text.dn7:3.8: “But reverends, I know and see like this.
translation_text.dn7:3.10: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’. …
translation_text.dn7:4.1: They project and extend the mind toward knowledge and vision …
translation_text.dn7:4.2: When a mendicant knows and sees like this, would it be appropriate to say of them:
translation_text.dn7:4.3: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’?”
translation_text.dn7:4.6: “But reverends, I know and see like this.
translation_text.dn7:4.8: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’. …
translation_text.dn7:5.1: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’
translation_text.dn7:5.2: When a mendicant knows and sees like this, would it be appropriate to say of them:
translation_text.dn7:5.3: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’?”
translation_text.dn7:5.6: “But reverends, I know and see like this.
translation_text.dn7:5.8: ‘The soul and the body are one and the same’ or ‘The soul is one thing, the body another’.”
translation_text.dn7:5.9: That is what the Buddha said.
translation_text.dn7:5.10: Satisfied, the two renunciates approved what the Buddha said.
